org.macroing.gdt.opencl

Class RayCaster

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amd.aparapi.Kernel
      • org.macroing.gdt.opencl.RayCaster
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener

    public final class RayCaster
extends com.amd.aparapi.Kernel
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener
    An OpenCL-based Ray Caster using Aparapi.

    The values in the float array cameraValues consists of Eye X, Eye Y, Eye Z, Up X, Up Y, Up Z, Look-at X, Look-at Y, Look-at Z, ONB-U X, ONB-U Y, ONB-U Z, ONB-V X, ONB-V Y, ONB-V Z, ONB-W X, ONB-W Y, ONB-W Z and View-plane distance.

    If you don't know what ONB stands for, then it is OrthoNormal Basis.

    The values in the float array intersections consists of Shape Offset and Distance (T), for each shape currently being intersected by a ray.

    The values in the float array lights consists of Type, Size and float[Size], for each light defined.

    The values in the float array rays consists of Origin X, Origin Y, Origin Z, Direction X, Direction Y and Direction Z, for each ray fired from each pixel.

    The values in the float array shapes consists of Type, Size and float[Size], for each shape defined.

    The controls currently defined are the following:

    • A - Move left.
    • D - Move right.
    • E - Display the current execution mode to standard output.
    • ESC - Exit the program. You may have to press a few times if you're using the execution mode JTP (Java Thread Pool), as it's pretty unresponsive.
    • S - Move backward.
    • T - Toggle between the two execution modes GPU and JTP (Java Thread Pool).
    • W - Move forward.

    The features currently supported are the following:

    • Shapes such as planes, spheres and triangles.
    • Lights such as point lights.
    • Textures such as normal color textures.
    • Texture mapping such as spherical texture mapping.
    • Ray Casting, which corresponds to the primary rays of Ray Tracing. This means no reflections and refractions are shown. At least not yet.

    Note that the features above will probably be expanded upon with time.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Jörgen Lundgren
